pages.title: Gateway
pages.text: <thing>Gateways/$ are multiblocks that allow creating a world-wide, interdimensional portal network, which players and other entities can teleport through. <item>Gateway Edge/$ and a <item>Gateway Controller/$ can be built into a multiblock <item>Gateway/$.$(br2)In order to connect to another <item>gateway
<item>/$, one of the <item>gateways/$ has to be dialed, and will produce <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/technomancy)temporal entropy/$ as a byproduct.$(br2)

pages.title: Unformed Multiblock
pages.text: The <item>gateway/$ multiblock is formed by building a vertical hollow square ring out of

<item>gateway edge/$, with the top center block replaced with a <item>gateway controller/$. The square must be an odd number of blocks long, at least 5x5 outside, one block depth, and the ring should have a width of (side length)/5 blocks (round down). So a 5x5, 7x7, or 9x9 ring has a 1 block thick ring, a 11x11 or 13x13 ring has a 2 block thick ring, etc. The multiblock is formed by right-clicking

Each <item>gateway/$ has an 'address' of 4 <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/beam)alignments/$ that is unique to that <item>gateway/$. It can be checked with either an <item>$(l:crossroads:intro/omnimeter)omnimeter/$ or <item>$(l:crossroads:technomancy/goggles)modular goggles/$ with quartz. In order to link two <item>gateways/$- allowing teleportation between them- one of the <item>gateways/$ must dial the 'address' of the other.$(br2)A <item>gateway/$ is dialed using <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/beam)beams/$ and an <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/rotary)axle/$ connection on

the top center block. The formed <item>gateway/$ multiblock has a large central 'dialing wheel' with 8 sides- each side is labeled with a different icon representing one of the <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/beam)beam alignments/$.$(br2)When the <item>gateway controller/$ (top center block) receives a <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/beam)beam/$ pulse, the currently selected <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/beam)alignment/$ will be dialed. The selected <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/beam)alignment/$ is the one

on the section of the 'dialing wheel' at the top of the multiblock, under the giant pointer.$(br2)The dialing wheel will rotate to the angle in radians equal to the <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/rotary)speed/$ of the attached <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/rotary)axle connection/$ on the top of the <item>controller/$. The angle of the wheel does not immediately move to match the <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/rotary)speed/$- it will slowly rotate (at a rate of Ï€/2

rad/s, maximum time between two points being 2 seconds) to the correct angle. Every time one of the 4 <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/beam)alignments/$ is dialed in, the <thing>angle defined by each speed will change/$. After the first <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/beam)alignments/$ is dialed in, the dialing wheel angle will be <thing>(axle speed)/$ - (speed when the first alignment was locked in) radians. After the second <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/beam)alignments/$ is dialed in, it will be <thing>(axle speed)

<thing>/$ - (speed when the second alignment was locked in) radians. And so on. After the final <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/beam)alignments/$ is dialed in, the reference speed resets to 0, and angle=<thing>(axle speed)/$ again. The <item>gateway/$ itself has an <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/rotary)I value/$ of 0.$(br2)When the fourth <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/beam)alignment/$ is locked in, the <item>gateway/$ will link with the <item>gateway/$ with the dialed 'address', and the 'dialing

wheel' will reset angle. This link lasts until a new 'address' is dialed.$(br2)The <item>gateway/$ that dialed the connection (not the receiving end!) will produce 1 <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/technomancy)temporal entropy/$ per tick while connected. Both players and other entities can travel through <item>gateways/$.$(br2)<item>$(l:essentials/circuits#reader)Circuits/$ on any part of the <item>gateway/$
will measure the total number of locked in <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/beam)alignments/$.$(br2)

The <item>Endpoint Controller/$ can be used in place of a normal <item>gateway controller/$ as a cheaper, simpler alternative. A <item>gateway/$ created using the <item>endpoint controller/$ doesn't produce <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/technomancy)temporal entropy/$, doesn't need a <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/rotary)rotary input/$, and doesn't need <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/beam)beams/$.$(br2)However, it

can not dial to any <thing>gateway/$ but other <thing>gateways/$ can dial to it. The connection is still two-directional.$(br2)In addition, if the <item>endpoint controller/$ is given a redstone signal, it will create a connection to the last <item>gateway/$ it was connected to (the other gateway will be the one that produces <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/technomancy)temporal entropy/$).$(br2)

This means you can setup one normal <thing>gateway/$ with a full dialing system to act as a hub, that goes to many different simple <thing>endpoint gateways/$, all of which connect back to the hub.$(br2)
